    • Method Detail

      • getExtraOrThrow

        public static <T> T getExtraOrThrow(java.lang.String key,
                                    android.os.Bundle... bundles)
        Convenience method for retrieving an object (no primitives) from a Bundle. If more than one of the Bundles passed contains an entry with the given key, the first object found is returned.

        An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if there is no entry with the given key.

        Sample use in a Fragment: 

         public void onActivityCreated( Bundle savedInstanceState ) {

 super.onActivityCreated( savedInstanceState );
 News news = BundleChecker.getExtraOrThrow( "key", new Bundle[]{ getArguments(),
 savedInstanceState } );
 }
        Parameters:
        key - - The key with which to search for in the given bundles
        bundles - - an array of Bundle to look for an entry with the given key
        Returns:
        The entry with the given key
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is no entry with the given key

      • getExtra

        public static <T> T getExtra(java.lang.String key,
                             android.os.Bundle... bundles)
        Convenience method for retrieving an object (no primitives) from a Bundle. If more than one of the Bundles passed contains an entry with the given key, the first object found is returned.

        Sample use in a Fragment: 

         public void onActivityCreated( Bundle savedInstanceState ) {

 super.onActivityCreated( savedInstanceState );
 String key = BundleChecker.getExtra( "key", new Bundle[]{ getArguments(), savedInstanceState
 } );
 if(key != null) {

 //...
 }
 }
        Parameters:
        key - - The key with which to search for in the given bundles
        bundles - - an array of Bundle to look for an entry with the given key
        Returns:
        The entry with the given key, or null if there is no entry with the given key

      • getExtra

        public static <T> T getExtra(java.lang.String key,
                             T defaultValue,
                             android.os.Bundle... bundles)
        Convenience method for retrieving an object (no primitives) from a Bundle. If more than one of the Bundles passed contains an entry with the given key, the first object found is returned.

        Sample use in a Fragment: 

         public void onActivityCreated(Bundle savedInstanceState){

        super.onActivityCreated(savedInstanceState);
        long id = BundleChecker.getExtra("id", -1L, getArguments(), savedInstanceState);
 }
        Parameters:
        key - - The key with which to search for in the given bundles
        defaultValue - - The value returned if the key cannot be found in a bundle
        bundles - - an array of Bundle to look for an entry with the given key
        Returns:
        The entry with the given key, or null if there is no entry with the given key
